candidates.title: RUST-707 Swap from time::PreciseTime to std::time::Instant
RUST-696: update all dependencies that don't have breaking changes
RUST-682 Update encryption dependencies

candidates.body: This PR leaves PBKDF2 at 0.6 instead of 0.7 to avoid bumping MSRV to 1.47.

candidates.title: RUST-633 update driver to use tokio 1.0
RUST-623 Upgrade os_info to 3.0.1

labels.name: tracked-in-jira
labels.description: Ticket filed in Mongo's Jira system

candidates.body:
When running this library on alpine I received the error 
```
os_info::imp::lsb_release lsb_release command failed with Os { 
code: 2, kind: NotFound, message: "No such file or directory" 
}
```
I think this has been fixed in a later version of os_info
https://github.com/stanislav-tkach/os_info/commit/602ff91f0904a4673a96f56fe79fb8a46222fa72  

This patch up grades os-info to 3.0.1

candidates.title: Remove unused dependencies: futures-intrusive

labels.name: tracked-in-jira
labels.description: Ticket filed in Mongo's Jira system

candidates.body: [RUSTSEC-2020-0072](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0072) valid for `futures-intrusive <0.4.0`, but since `futures-intrusive` is not used in crate this dependency can be removed.

candidates.title: RUST-617 Add BSON benchmarks
candidates.body: It looks like in my previous rebase and merge, I accidentally left off the changes to using the runtime-specific I/O APIs, so I included it here as a separate commit from the BSON work (and tagged separately with the ticket number for the previous PR as well).

candidates.title: RUST-613 Upgrade typed-builder to 0.4.0
candidates.body: This PR upgrades the `typed-builder` dependency to version 0.4.0. The latest `typed-builder` version is 0.8.0, but upgrading to this version entails breaking changes for users, so we will hold off on this upgrade until we reach 2.0.

candidates.title: RUST-611 Port benchmarking suite from `unreviewed-impl` to current state of driver
candidates.body: As part of the initial work to get benchmarks in evergreen, I updated the benchmarking suite from the `unreviewed-impl` branch to account for the API changes since it was written (which are mostly due to changing the driver to be async). I made a commit that dropped in the benchmarks as-is and then a subsequent one with my changes both to give @benjirewis credit for his work and to make the review process for the changes easier.

candidates.title: RUST-575 Consider connection pool health during server selection
candidates.body:
RUST-575

This PR updates server selection to consider the number of ongoing operations a each server has instead of randomly selecting from among those in the latency window. This done as part of DRIVERS-781 Avoiding Connection Storms. See https://github.com/mongodb/specifications/commit/07790d1978ebe6b8ff7f574c9ac5e1365dd16e26 for the spec changes.

This also fixes RUST-592.

candidates.title: Added optional bson u2i feature

labels.name: tracked-in-jira
labels.description: Ticket filed in Mongo's Jira system

candidates.body: The BSON crate offered the "unsigned integer to integer (u2i)" auto conversion feature. Since the crate is now reexported, it would be nice to still be able to use this.
